Right of Way License
recordTypes.description: A Town Right-of-Way License is required for issuance of a Right-of-Way Permit or Sanitary Sewer Permit from the Town Engineering Division.  This license requires a $10,000 Right-of-Way Bond and a current insurance certificate that provides the required minimum coverage and waiver of subrogation as per the Town's insurance requirements. This license expires annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Water Treatment Wastewater Disposal System
recordTypes.description:
Permit expires one year from date of issuance if construction fails to start with the one year period. Fee

to commencement of installation.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
The CT State Building Code requires building permits to construct, alter, or renovate any structure or building in compliance with the minimum standards of the CT State Building Code and in accordance with the approved plans and specifications submitted with your application. 

Commercial Building Permits must have architectural plans showing elevations, floor plans, and structural design specifications and elevation grades. Plans for tenant spaces in buildings over 5000 square feet must have the seal of a design professional, registered in the State of Connecticut, and contain all information required by the CT State Building Code and State Fire Code.  Larger sets of plans may be requested in hard copy to the Building Department for ease of reviewing. Complete plans must include electrical, plumbing, HVAC, sprinkler, and all other required information. Plans must comply with these requirements before they can be approved construction.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: Sanitary Sewer Permits are required for all activities performed on the sanitary sewer system, whether located within Town-owned property or within private property on the exterior of the building. These activities include the installation or repair of a private sanitary sewer house connection, street sewer, sewer trunk line, or any other activity involving the sanitary sewer system.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal / Open Burning Permit
recordTypes.description:
(1) This is a valid permit only when signed by the Local Open Burning Official;
(2) The permit does not relieve the permittee of any legal liability, which may be incurred as a result of the fire;
(3) Failure to adhere to the conditions of the permit may result in forfeiture of this permit and/or other enforcement actions;

This Permit is NOT VALID UNDER THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
(a) When national or state ambient air quality standards may be exceeded
(b) Where a hazardous health condition might be created
(c) When the Air Quality Index (AQI) is forecast to be 100 or higher anywhere in the state
(d) When the Forest Fire Danger Index is high, very high, or extreme
(e) When there is an advisory from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection (DEEP) Commissioner of any air pollution episode
(f) Burning of any material other than brush
(g) On property other than residential property upon which the permittee resides

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
Demolition Permits are for removing structures or parts thereof and not any part of an interior demolition. Please choose this only if you intend on taking down or knocking down a structure or outbuilding.
Other than Home owners, a Home Improvement Contractors license is required for demolition of residential structures and their associated accessory structures.
